title: $$\frac{Equation}{Substitute}$$
text: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is $$\frac{a\left(x_1\right)-a\left(x_2\right)}{x_1-x_2}$$. So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in $$9+h$$ for $$x_1$$ and $$9$$ for $$x_2$$, and we get the expression $$\frac{\frac{1}{9+h+4}-\frac{1}{9+4}}{9+h-9}$$.
speech: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is  fraction, a of, parentheses x sub 1  minus, a of, parentheses x sub 2 , over, x sub 1 minus x sub 2,  .
